Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown; part of pomegranate in added white with added red circles; attached to the pomegranate, a short vertical line connecting it with two white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of female figure (lower part of garment and feet in outline remaining) to left; below, two lines.
Curator's comments: Although Lemos does not describe this sherd, it ought to belong in her Group of Worshippers within the Simple Animal Style. The lead vase from this group is the St Petersburg chalice from Berezan (Lemos no. 964) which has the degenerate conical chalice form typical of the Simple Animal Style. The figural decoration on the vase is rendered primarily, and carelessly, in outline. The handle zone and rim pattern decoration are consistent with other chalices of the same style. Most of the vases in this Simple Animal Style group display a mixture of techniques, with female figures portrayed in outline and dancing komasts in black-figure.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1100) (phase 2)
